channel.title: [PI] DDS spec switch bug
channel.description:
Hi all, i'm having a problem on my server with people doing dds spec then switching to a high str weapon realy fast and it gives 2 high hits. I was thinking if i could find a way to reset the spec if they changed weapon too fast so that it would just hit once then that would solve it, only im not sure how i could do this.
Can anyone help? Thanks in advance.:D

item.title: [PI] DDS spec switch bug
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

@pyro Wow… Dude just listen to I vain I…

@I vain I
Keep up the good work.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] DDS spec switch bug
item.dc:creator: @pyro_sauce pyro sauce
item.description:
@pyro_sauce wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=pyro sauce link=topic=465345.msg3458848#msg3458848 date=1294283641]

[quote author=I Vain I link=topic=465345.msg3458839#msg3458839 date=1294283225]

why the fuck would you want a timer on switching? it would frustrate the fuck out of all your players.

no; what you want to do is calculate the hits at the start of your combat cycle, that’s how RuneScape does it.

I guess a quick easy fix for just the dds spec would be declaring a variable, setting it to equal your strength bonus every start of the combat cycle, and edit the maximum hit method to use that variable instead of the strength bonus.
[/quote]RuneScape uses timers on weapon switching, and what you just said, made absolutely no sense.

right… of course i dont know what im doing because im some noob… i forgot that. just fyi timer will solve nothing. look at combatassistant.java and actually think about it while looking through
[/quote]I never called you a noob, and timers will solve it, as I’ve fixed it myself on my own base.[/quote]
no see a timer ‘fixes’ it it doesnt really fix the problem. and there are ways around it too.

Read full topic
